Curator's comments: This ostracon yields a so-called r-rḫ=w ("that which was measured") text. These texts, all originating from the Thebaid in the Ptolemaic and early- Roman period, were issued to farmers after a measurement of their cultivated land had been conducted in order to determine due amounts of harvest tax. (Information provided by Gert Baetens, KULeuven) Bibliography: Kaplony-Heckel No.30A. Kaplony-Heckel, U., 2006, Theben-Ost III (2) : Die r-rḫ=w Tempel Quittungen und ähnliche Texte, Theben Ost Teil 3, zweiter Teil, Texte Nr.26-44, ZÄS 133, pp.36. Kaplony-Heckel, U., 2009, Land und Leute am Nil nach demotischen Inschriften, Papyri und Ostraca, Gesammelte Schriften Teil 2, Harrassowitz Verlag; Wiesbaden, pp.936. On the text genre, see: For r-rḫ=w texts, cf. Vandorpe K., 'The Ptolemaic Epigraphe or Harvest tax (shemu)', in Archiv für Papyrusforschung 46 (2000), p. 165-228. Kaplony-Heckel U., Thebanische Acker- Amt-Quittungen, in Allam, S., Grund und Boden in Altägypten (rechtliche und sozio-ökonomische Verhältnisse): Akten des internationalen Symposions Tübingen 18.-20. Juni 1990 (Untersuchungen zum Rechtsleben im alten Ägypten; Band 2) Tübingen, 1994, pp. 189-197.
